response.original_title: Le Bambou enchanté ou l'univers magique des Jawi de Thaïlande du Sud
response.overview: The Jawi are the descendants of the former Malay sultanate of Patani, annexed in 1909 by Siam (became Thailand). Since then, the situation has been generating a bloody endemic guerrilla in these provinces of Southern Thailand. The memory of the famous past hindouist kingdom of Langkasuka, predecessor of Patani, is still living among the Jawi, in the guise of their legendary and divine White Elephant with Black Tusks.
response.title: The Enchanted Bamboo or the Magical Universe of the Jawi of Southern Thailand
